result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tasha R. Shimek

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Tasha R. Shimek appeared by video, in custody at Manitowoc County Jail and by Atty. Ann Larson, appearing by zoom.  Not guilty plea.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-01-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of violate harassment injunction.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-18-22 at 10:30 a.m. B-15.  Bail is set at $250.00 recognizance bond with the condition that she have no contact with D.L.V., DOB: 08-14-1970.    Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. 
Minutes.
